Others: The Washington Wizards won their 6th game of the season, beating the Chicago Bulls 125-107.
Bub Carrington and Justin Champagnie, former Pitt players, both turned in solid games for the Wizards.
Carrington led the team in minutes played with 31, going 4 for 5 from the field, including 3 for 3 from three-point range.
Champagnie played 21 minutes in the win, scoring 15 points and grabbing two boards.
Carrington was the first player drafted in the first round from a Jeff-Capel-led Pitt team.
Champagnie played two seasons at Pitt from 2019-21, earning All-ACC honors in 2020-21.
